title: Will some of the older champs get their autoattacks updated?
body: So I play lots of mid lane mages and I've noticed that some of the newer champs (Vel'Koz and Azir are who I'm thinking of primarily) have much smoother and easier to cs with AA while champs like Casseiopia and Anivia have horrific AA. Are there any plans to update these or are the AA considered a part of the champ's balance?

I believe they didn't touch any of her animations when they worked on her model. 

So she's technically an old champion, especially compared to most.

A model does not move on it own. Someone has to work it.

If it looks the same as with the old model, it's because they made it so.

A champions auto animation is a part of their balance, yes. You know why Vlad has such a shitty auto animation? So he sometimes has to use Q and E to last hit and give his opponents openings to attack him. You know why Vel'koz has such a snappy auto animation? Because his waveclear spell is absolute garbage at securing CS until lvl 7.

I find that the most painful AA animation is a low attack speed vayne
the projectile isn't terrible its the winding up animation thats terrible when you have low attack speed

One thing I'd like is to see Riot smooth out champion auto attacks for attack speed.  If you build some AS on a champ, you shouldn't have to deal with a clunky AA that looks like it's canceling mid animation because the next AA hit before the animation finished.
